title: Project researcher in separation technology and biorefining
field: Bioengineering, Biotechnology, Chemical Engineering, Microbiology, Solid-state Chemistry, and 1 moreSurface Chemistry
job_description: The LUT School of Engineering Science is looking for a project researcher for a project focusing on the separation of biobased textile finishing agents from plant biomass side streams. The aim of our project is to develop a sustainable and efficient process for the recovery of valuable pigments and antimicrobial compounds from e.g. autumn leaves or waste streams of greenhouse flowers and vegetable production. The recovery of valuable compounds will be carried out by solid-liquid extraction and membrane-based technologies. The project will be implemented in co-operation with research teams from the University of Helsinki and VTT. We expect applicants to have background in chemical engineering or chemistry, demonstrated skills in experimental work and at least basic knowledge of instrumental analysis. A Masterâs degree or the equivalent in a relevant field (e.g. chemical engineering, chemistry or similar) is required. Any previous experience or interest in membrane technology, solid-liquid extractions, applied chemistry, chemistry of natural compounds and biorefinery field is considered an advantage (but not a must). This position is suitable for motivated and self-directed candidates who are interested in conducting scientific research with a purpose. The work includes planning, laboratory work and reporting results. There is also a possibility for doctoral studies (negotiable with interested candidates). Fluent communication skills in Finnish and English are appreciated. The fixed-term employment starts at the earliest in April 2022 with a six-month trial period and ends on 30 March 2024. The work is mainly located at the Department of Separation Science on LUT Universityâs Lahti campus.
